title: @Riot, if you give Dr.Mundo a visual update in what direction would his appearance and story change?
body:
It's pretty set that Dr.Mundo will get a visual update. The last time he was talked about was in 2014 i think, by IronStylus. So what are the current plans for him?

What do you think is Dr.Mundo's core trait that you would definitely keep?

Would he keep his puny legs while having a tremendously muscular upper body?

Dr.Mundo is on one side really silly and on the other pretty dark (Killing pets, parents, pain inflicting).

If he were to be reworked, would he rather be more silly or serious? 



**Personally** i would like him to get the Ryze and GP treatment. Making a champion whose personally is seen more as a joke, more legit.

replies.body:
I think Mundo should remain kinda comical,but also show his smart and diabolical side from time to time.

He is the kind of guy,that looks like a complete idiot,acts like a complete idiot,but is still a complete sadistic evil scientist.
So basically, uncomfortably comical when you think about his sadistic side?

I guess that describes it pretty good.
If his comical side is geniunly funny,then it can help to highlight his sinister side.


I think there is a story with the joker that expresses this pretty good.
In said story,the joker hijacks some sort of tv-show that is broadcasted live.
The owner of the show continues the broadcast,because he knows that the joker killing people in his show would actually give him a good amount of views.
However the joker doesn't kill anyone and instead plays harmless pranks on his victims.
And this actually made the joker all the more scarier,because everyone knew that he would gleefully murder everyone if he felt like it.

He actually gleefully murdered everyone in a talk show in The Dark Knight Returns, so yeah it makes sense. Only problem i have with this is Shaco already being a Joker reference, wouldn't that confuse too much?

Nah.
After all its not like I want Dr.Mundo to be a complete ripoff of the joker,its just this one aspect where they'd be creepy in a similar manner.
Eh... hard to say if Riot would be able to divide these two things, though it would be really interesting.
Like Joker in Batman the Animated Series?
What confuses me about mundo is that his lore makes him seem like a dark,twisted scientific genius but ingame he has the IQ of a potato.

The way I understand it he drugged himself in ways that messes up his way of speech and ability to remembr his name,simply because he saw these things as unimportant.
However his scientific knowledge was unaffected by that,so even if he talks like a complete idiot he'd be still rather smart.

I think it would be nice, for his intro animation (when game starts), to be a rather smart scientist injecting a needle into his body and turning into the Mundo we know now. Since I would like him to keep his gameplay, but present a glimpse of the genius behind.

I feel like they could make him more menacing after all he is a sadomasochistic mad scientist.
i like it.
The strange case of Dr. Jekyll and [Mundo!](http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/0/0a/DrMundo.ogg/revision/latest?cb=20120615005341)
Would at least explain why a brilliant scientist acts like an idiot most of the time.

Not really sure where we would actually go whenever we do get around to Mundo. Once we put a whole team of creative people on a project it can change quite a bit from our initial feelings as the project evolves overtime. 

I will say that one idea I always thought that would be cool for a Mundo VGU is to go the Dr Jekyll/Mr Hyde Route, or at least our twist on it. Where his ult makes him go all Mr Hyde, but he is usually Dr. Jekyll

Hey, Reav3! Gonna use this as an opportunity to quote an old post of mine from last year. I made it on the "Making of the Madman" blog post and it didn't get much attention. It talks about how (at the time, it seems you guys may have changed this stance) there were no plans to update Mundo due to his popularity. I thought this was a bad idea and wanted to outline some of the things that in my opinion work really well about his character, and those that don't.

Sorry it's so long, just some food for thought if you see this!


> [{quoted}](name=ColdStone Memery,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=riK28gK6,comment-id=003e,timestamp=2015-11-11T00:38:07.801+0000)
>
> While I appreciate that you guys want to hold on to the aspects on Mundo that make him so fun and likable, I think it's really a mistake to not plan on changing him up in the near future of league. You can keep his campy personality and so forth, but you have to admit that his model is pretty atrocious by today's standards. 
> 
> Look at all the amazing concepts you guys have come out with lately - you could definitely do justice to the crazy mad scientist/hulk trope better than what Mundo is today. Something that's been lost to a lot of people who complain about League getting "edgier" is that you can be polished AND fun. Jinx isn't super serious, neither is Ekko. Hell, look at Tahm! Mundo could be a comical character who is actually that - a character, not simply a big joke. We laugh AT Mundo, when we should be laughing with him. There's nothing wrong with being silly and fun, but he shouldn't be a walking joke. That's why Sion and Gangplank were changed visually and thematically (I understand the issues people have with Gangplank being much too dark/serious now compared to before, but at least he feels like a character rather than a stereotype. I personally prefer the Captain GP skin's voiceover as I feel it retains a lot of dark humor from his character compared to the vengeance-focused base GP).
> 
> In the same vein, his kit -needs- work. I love what you've done with his E recently, it feels awesome and opens up a lot of new playstyles and item builds. But his kit as a whole isn't cohesive, and cohesivity has been one of League's most important character themes for over two years now. Look at how thematic Yasuo or Rek'sai's kit is. Or if you want less "OP overloaded etc" kits, even something as simple as reworked Caitlyn - something as basic as making her headshots interact with traps and nets, as well as making her Q thin to start with, make her feel so much more like a sharpshooter than before. 
> 
> Does Mundo feel like a hulked-out madman? His ult certainly does, and his Q, though a bit out there design-wise as you guys mentioned, fits very well. His E even feels better now, giving him a kind of "hulk smash" feeling when it activates. W and passive though? His passive is so boring. We have passives like Kindred marking, Darius bleed and Noxian Might, Soraka's reworked "ambulance". These things add GAMEPLAY. Just like Heimer's sorry passive, Mundo's passive is simply a stat boost, and an unexciting one at that. It _works_ don't get me wrong, but is it fun? Does it ever really feel good? If you escape with a few health you won't be thinking "Thanks .3% hpregen!" It just doesn't feel good. 
> 
> His W fills an important niche for a tank, the "I need to do damage while sticking on a target and being threatening" one, but it's just not satisfying either. Like you mentioned, the particle being weird has a lot to do with that. Imagine if Mundo had a kind of Thornmail-esque passive where all damage he takes (not just autos) is reflected back partially on opponents in melee range of him from his acidic, chemically-altered blood. That would feel good and fit well for the character's theme, even open up gameplay paths like not focusing the good Dr. down when he's in melee range of your squishy, making you want to kite him back first in order to not damage whoever he's near. Just a spitballed idea for something that fills the same kind of niche as his W, but makes a lot more sense than fireballs that do damage around his body because Mundo.
> 
> I really hope no one takes this the wrong way. I don't want to change who Mundo is. I enjoy a good Mundo game as much as anymore, I love going where I please and being a general pain to the enemy. I love cleaver sniping and landing a permaslow on a level 1 invade. But he could be so much **more**. He could be a Dr. Hyde style madman, hulked out of control and **out of his mind**. He could still be funny, comical and carefree. He could still go where he pleases and walk all over enemy champions but he could feel more interesting and cohesive whilst doing so. Just food for thought, and I hope a Red sees this and can it into consideration. I can't be the only person who would trade a bit of nostalgia and silliness for a more interesting character, especially when I don't think interesting and silly are necessarily mutually exclusive.  Sorry for the long post!
Agreed with everything you are saying about changing him up a lot. Once we get to him he would almost certainly be a large Sion/Poppy/Taric sized rework. :)

Not a bad idea with his W but the main reason I like it is the constant cc reduction.  Being able to shrug off ANYTHING is what makes mundo mundo.
I know that's the basic idea behind Mundo, but I'd be careful not to overlap with Gnar too much (who is also based on Jekyll/Hyde, IIRC)
Of course! Like I said was just a random thought, we could go tons of different directions with him.
I think he should always be purple and have a cleaver, at least that.

The name Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde come up so many times when talking about Dr.Mundo and i dont get the reference. But after googling him i realized that i saw him in two movies... The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen and Van Helsing. It's from the 19th century, so i guess Bruce Banner / the Hulk was inspired by him as well.

I think Mundo needs to keep his idiocy and slight silliness, because he is supposed to be an Incredible Hulk/Jekyll Hyde reference, and they can manage to squeeze in his darkness in some ways, such as fleeting moments of clarity similar to how Kalista has moments where she recalls her past. 
I would hope he gets a full blown VGU, and not a Gangplank/Ryze level VGU, because I feel like he needs a lot more work in the kit department to stay relevant.
